original: Jeppsson, Johan, rektor, Hemse, f. 7/11/85 i Ö. Nöbbelöv, Krist. 1., av Ola J. o. Johanna Mårtensson. G. 1. 08 m. Johanna Boman; 2. 35 m. Alma Jonsson. Barn: Elsa f. 09, Knut 11, Svea 12, Carl Gustaf 14, Kerstin 16, Sif 18, Gunnel 23, Gerd 24, Hans Erik 32, Ingrid Margareta 38. — Stud:ex. v. Lunds priv. elem:sk. 06, folksk:-iär:ex. v. Lunds’ siem. 07, fil. kand. v. Lunds univ. 15. Res. t. folkhögsk. i S. Sv:e o. Danm. 14, t. Tyskl., Tjec-koslov., Ungern o. Danm. 28, nord. stud :veckan i Finl. 35, Norrl. o. Norge 37. Vik. lär. v. Kastlösa folksk. i Kv’rstO’fta förs. 07-08, dito v. Västerviks folksk. 08, e. o. där. där 08, ord. övn:lär. v. Gotl. 1. folkhögsk. 08-34, vik. förest, där 22, förest. 34-42, rektor v. Gotl. 1. folkhögsk. i Hemse sed. 42. Led. av styr. f. Gotl. 1. folkhögsk. elevförb. sed. 15, v. ordf. i komm:stämman i Hemse 27-34, led. av komm:ndn där 28-38, ordf. i Gotl. distr. av JUF 20-22. Skr.: Kvinnans tankeliv i tjugoårsåldern (16), Modersmålsproblemet i folkhögsk. (17), Föredragets fördelar o. olägenheter ur kunskapsmeddelandets synpunkt (18), Ett skolproblem (18), Riktlinjer f. en blivande kommunal reform (19), Känsdotänkande o. folkuppfostran (20), Gotl. 1. folkhögsk. Några korta anteckn. om skolans tillkomst o. ut-veckl. 1876-1910 (22), ett stort antal art. i skilda ämnen i ortspressen. Hobby: trädg:skötsel.
translated: Jeppsson, Johan, principal, Hemse, b. 7/11/85 in Ö. Nöbbelöv, Kristianstad County, son of Ola J. and Johanna Mårtensson. Married 1st in 1908 to Johanna Boman; 2nd in 1935 to Alma Jonsson. Children: Elsa b. 1909, Knut b. 1911, Svea b. 1912, Carl Gustaf b. 1914, Kerstin b. 1916, Sif b. 1918, Gunnel b. 1923, Gerd b. 1924, Hans Erik b. 1932, Ingrid Margareta b. 1938. — Received high school diploma from Lund private elementary school in 1906, elementary school teacher diploma from Lund seminarium in 1907, Bachelor of Arts from Lund University in 1915. Traveled to folk high schools in Sweden and Denmark in 1914, to Germany, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, and Denmark in 1928, participated in Nordic study trips to Finland in 1935, Northern Sweden, and Norway in 1937. Substitute teacher at Kastlösa elementary school in Kv’rstO’fta parish from 1907-1908, substitute teacher at Västervik elementary school in 1908, provisional teacher there in 1908, regular practice teacher at Gotland 1st folk high school from 1908-1934, temporary supervisor there in 1922, supervisor from 1934-1942, rector of Gotland 1st folk high school in Hemse since 1942. Member of the board of Gotland 1st folk high school student association since 1915, vice chairman of the municipality meeting in Hemse from 1927-1934, member of the municipal board there from 1928-1938, chairman of the Gotland district of the Youth Democratic League from 1920-1922. Writings: A Woman's Intellectual Life in the Twenties (1916), The Mother Tongue Problem in Folk High Schools (1917), Advantages and Disadvantages of Lecturing from the Perspective of Knowledge Communication (1918), A School Problem (1918), Guidelines for a Future Municipal Reform (1919), Emotional Thinking and Popular Education (1920), Gotland 1st Folk High School: Brief Notes on the School's Establishment and Development 1876-1910 (1922), and a large number of articles on various subjects in local newspapers. Hobby: gardening.
